title: Who originally said 'Win the battle lose the war? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pyhrrus of Epirus is credited with coining the quote. But essentially it is an analytic strategem meaning, that the ends have to justify the means or cost. Very much so that a hard won victory can leave you breathless, weak and defenseless. Oftentimes crippled, cut off from reinforcements and unable to further act on the rights and privileges fought for and won. Think Vietnam, Afghanistan and Russia in terms of war, all these countries have never been conquered, even while defeated in many battles over centuries of warfare. At the end of the day the aggressor always left the theater unsuccessful and often with their tails between the legs.
